title: MoonFlair Spell Blade
body: So, is there a reason we can't have it in SR? Its actually a decent, but not op IMO item. It adds an alternative armor/mr item than just ZZ'rot and GA, and it even gives an alternative to Merc treads for tenacity.

replies.body: Also, as an added bonus, it has a really nice looking icon.

Why are there so many downvotes?

Moonflair Spellblade's base stats are 119.5% gold efficient, without the passive.
I am NOT saying having this item on the rift would be bad.
But this current one is really strong. It would need to be adjusted.
Similar to how RoA is not the same in certain game modes.

My point is, it would not be the same. But ok, sorry for sharing my opinion :(
it could simply be more expensive

> or raise its price

That's what I'm suggesting.
I think it would be nice to have alternative tenacity sources.
Why have a whole stat dedicated to Merc's passive?

But if it's too cost efficient, it'll be Rylai's all over again.
Mages would just buy it for the crazy stats rather than its passive.

I'm thinking 3000 G or 3100 G (still getting a bargain at this price).
Zz'rot and GA both lose out on stats, because of how powerful their passives are.
Moonflair Spellblade should not be an exception.

To those who down vote me. What is wrong with my comment?
Is it not constructive? I put thought and time into it.

I am NOT shitposting. I am agreeing with the original post, but also pointing out that it is a very powerful item.

I am answering the OP's question 
>So, is there a reason we can't have it in SR?

If it were put into SR in its current state, it would dominate the game, because of how cheap yet powerful it is.
I am trying to offer insight into your post, but I guess I'm just an idiot.

If it is considered too powerful, I think the ap should be lowered. Tanks need another item.
I'd say APs need another item as well, but this one isn't that item.

Proposed stats:
50 armor = 1000 G
50 magic resistance = 900 G
10 ability power = 435 G
Value = 2335 G

For Moonflair Spellblade to be considered cost efficient, Tenacity must be worth at least 165 G (which I think is fair).

Defensive stats remain unchanged, AP is lowered significantly. So it's a fair item that still gets the job done without being overbearing.
Similarly, you could argue why not have Wooglet's in SR to have an alternative to Deathcap or Zhonya's. It could be, but its already cost effective by itself (also has a powerful active), and would need a price up.

Black Market Brawlers had Deadman's Plate. It remained on the rift as a momento. It has received multiple nerfs since then.
